intro: Lippia rzedowskii, commonly known as Mexican blueweed, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the verbena family (Verbenaceae) and is characterized by its aromatic, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in open woodlands and grasslands. Lippia rzedowskii is known for its medicinal properties, with various parts of the plant used in traditional remedies. It also serves as a source of nectar for pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
